keyPolicies.policyDescription: We need a House of Commons that reflects the make-up of Great Britain - gender, ethnicity, profession and trade.
The current 'first past the post' system is old, tired and does not serve the electorate. We favor implementing a modern and fair voting system.
With 800 Members, this is the second largest chamber in the world. It is unrepresentative, antiquated, unelected, and needs a modern, streamlined reform.

mentions.tacticalSituation: The real and present danger is only caused by Conservatives losing a seat such as Wycombe; they will change policies.

issues.environment: Are you worried about your Green Belt?
issues.health: Would you like the A & E returned to Wycombe General Hospital? - A & E Services at Wycombe General Hospital
issues.transport: Are you cross about those potholes?

community.content: Greenbelt/Housing Expansion: Do you agree with the current Greenbelt review and building on 'Londonise' Bucks by concreting over our fields? Do you really want 5,200 more houses in Wycombe affecting the communities of Tylers Green, Terriers, Hazlemere, Marlow Bottom, and our roads, schools, local NHS, schools, and water/sewerage services?

leaflet.personalStatement: Richard lives in High Wycombe with his wife Lizzie, daughter Mia and son Ben.

examples: 15% of our MPs are from the legal profession
23% went to Oxford & Cambridge Universities
25% of Conservative MP’s were from the Finance sector
33% are Privately educated
Only 29% of MPs are women
Only 6% of MPs are non-white
Only 3% represent manual workers
With 800 Members, this is the SECOND largest chamber in the world!
It is a disgrace that our great bastion of democracy is now so out of touch with who we are as a nation.
This 'first past the post' system is old, tired and does not serve the electorate.
Send a message to the Government and elect a local MP who will 100% focus on Wycombe, not on Conservative national policies.
This is a real and present danger caused only by the Conservatives losing a seat like Wycombe that will likely change local policies.
Apparently, we can afford £80 billion to rip up the Green Belt, but not to improve our urban and rural areas.
Are you concerned about the Housing expansion in Wycombe?
Would you like the A & E returned to Wycombe General Hospital?
Are you cross about those potholes?
If you are concerned about the wealth divide, then vote UKIP
If you are a Libertarian, then vote UKIP
If you wish to protect our Fishing industry, then vote UKIP

personalStories.story: Richard lives in High Wycombe with his wife Lizzie, daughter Mia and son Ben.

examples: This is too small an issue for Steve Baker to address, but not for an MP that is speaking solely for Wycombe.
Steve Baker has failed on this.
This is too small an issue for Steve Baker to address.

nonPolicyAttributes.family: Richard lives in High Wycombe with his wife Lizzie, daughter Mia and son Ben.

examples: Richard lives in High Wycombe.
